activities: UBC and its subsidiaries and affiliates may receive a number of different types of data from the EEA including data about:  employees, potential employees, and their family members; clinical and medical investigators and staff conducting clinical and medical research; study participants; consumers; investors and shareholders; and patient data.
contactoff1: Express Scripts Office of General Counsel
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: American Arbitration Association (AAA), ICDR/AAA Safe Harbor Program for non-human resources data:  EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for HR data only.
